HEATHER DUKE opens the envelope and pulls out a stack of 8 by 10's. She gasps. The first shot shows a YOUNG HEATHER DUKE in a summer camp uniform that vibrantly reads HEATHER, She is holding one end of a large poster board drawing of two Eskimos rubbing noses. Holding the other end, in a summer camp uniform vibrantly reading MARTHA, is a YOUNG MARTHA DUNNSTOCK/DUMPTRUCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the..... With a harsh laugh, she takes in the next photograph. It has YOUNG HEATHER DUKE and YOUNG MARTHA eating toasted marshmallows off each other's sticks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did you get these? J.D. Oh, I just had the nicest chat with Ms. Dumptruck. Got along famously! It's scary how everyone's got a story to tell....Would you care to see the canoeing shots?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want from me? J.D. Strength. Westerburg doesn't need mushy togetherness, it needs a leader. Heather Chandler was that leader but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she couldn't handle it. J.D. laughs. She's on the ball. J.D. I think you can. In Catcher in the Rye Holden says his ideal job'd be making sure some kids don't fall off a cliff. He doesn't realize if you pay too much attention to the kids, you'll back off the cliff yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very very. The photographs? J.D. Don't worry. I'll ask you to do me a favor. You'll get the negatives and everything back then. J.D. launches away from his desk with a grin. He places a red ribbon on HEATHER DUKE's desk. J.D. In the meantime, strength, And hey, there's a little gift. INT.   THE GIRLS BATHROOM A spooked HEATHER DUKE splashes water on her face and looks up into the mirror. In a trance, she pulls her hair back Heather Chandler fashion and ties it with the ribbon J.D. gave her. A BETTY FINN-A-LIKE moves up to the sink beside her. Two CHIC BABES enter the bathroom with pouting expressions. Seemingly in a trance, HEATHER DUKE bends over and wipes off her wet hands using the oblivious BETTY FINN-A-LIKE's dress. HEATHER DUKE winks to the now-giggling CHIC BABES and saunters off. HALLWAY HEATHER DUKE bursts through the bathroom door to wickedly strut down the hall. She scowls/smiles in perfect Heather Chandler fashion to various passers-by. EARL FRAZIER'S LOCKER VERONICA genially lobbys the big black EARL FRAZIER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me get it clear, Veronica. You want yourself a sweet homeboy for this T.V. show so you can show everybody what a loose, Martin Luther Cosby-lovng place Westerburg is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like that. Will you do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn, you're a shrewd one. Shrewd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want to show different kinds of people can get together and it doesn't have to be Vietnam. You don't get treated badly here do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get treated at all, but hey, don't worry about it. I'll do your thing. It'll give my Mom a smile. VERONICA hands him a Guest Pass tag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things are going to change, Earl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh. HEATHER DUKE impishly blinds VERONICA with her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heather. HEATHER DUKE lets go with a small giggle. VERONICA turns to face her Heather Chandler-looking friend and her smile dies. VERONICA violently pushes HEATHER DUKE away and storms off. INT.   VERONICA'S BEDROOM--NIGHT Lying on the floor, VERONICA concentrates on her phone. With a deep sigh, she pushbuttons out a number. She pauses, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ouch. Your machine's got the most obnoxious beep. Heather, I'm sorry. INT.   HEATHER DUKE'S BEDROOM VERONICA's voice drones through HEATHER DUKE's answering machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just calling to say you can wear your hair any way you want to. A Male hand picks up the phone. It's College boy DAVID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Veronica Sawyer, barf on anybody's carpet lately? VERONICA'S BEDROOM VERONICA cringes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this David? Heather's David? What are you doing.... HEATHER DUKE'S BEDROOM DAVID What can I say? I was pretty broken up by Heather C.'s suicide. I needed somebody super-sensitive like Heather D. VERONICA'S BEDROOM VERONICA I'm delirious for the both of you. Can you put Heather on? HEATHER DUKE'S BEDROOM DAVID proudly looks down off-screen to his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can't really talk right now. VERONICA'S BEDROOM VERONICA slams down the receiver and pulls up a sleek leather address book. She severely scans through it. Tossing it away, VERONICA then descends into the sundry junk of her night table drawer and draws up another address book; this one is frayed and pink polka-dotted. She peruses it and dials.....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Betty..... EXT.   SAWYER BACKYARD--DAY BETTY FINN hits her ball through a wicket and squeals in delight. VERONICA has a motherly smile on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe it. I'm winning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get cocky, girl. BETTY bends down to shoot then raises her body back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I missed you. I know I'm not as, as exciting as your other friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's bullshit. Just shoot. BETTY once again bends and raises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie, I'm still a virgin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoot. BETTY finally shoots. Feebly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Betty, your daydreams are a lot better than my realities, believe me. I'm afraid though it's time to get your butt kicked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie! VEONCIA gigglingly shoots, but misses the wicket. And instead hits BETTY's ball. Disturbed by the sudden dilemma, she determinedly walks to her ball and moves it away from BETTY's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you're not settling for the two shots are you? Knock me out girl. It's the only way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not my style, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice guys finish last. I should know. VERONICA sighs then knocks BETTY's adjacent ball sailing toward the porch and a statuesque HEATHER DUKE who does not budge as the ball whizzes past her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brav- o !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to get going, Veronica. See you at the studio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. See ya. HEATHER DUKE walks toward the girls followed by a meandering desultory HEATHER MCNAMARA, who picks up a green mallet and fragilely swings it; her early robustness a forgotten memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Croquet won't be the same without Heather. HEATHER DUKE hustles back toward a passing BETTY FINN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Betty, wait. I almost forgot...The Whitney James Teenage Suicide Prevention T.V. Special isn't going to be taped at the studios. It's going to be done in the Park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I thought...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's going to be like a big picnic. Bring some potato salad...HEY, I'M RED! LATER IN THE GAME HEATHER DUKE's red ball slams into HEATHER MCNAMARA's green one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So did you call people to tell them how to get to the studio tonight? HEATHER DUKE savagely "sends" HEATHER MACNAMARA's ball into the flower bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back off. I called everyone, even that Stoner slut. Felt like giving my phone a bath. I told Betty just now...Damn! HEATHER DUKE's shot swerves wide of the wicket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're so polluted. Talking down to people, making fake notes.... VERONICA blows her shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see what gives you the right to lecture, Ronnie . You were soulmates with Betty Finn until you realized you're the cover of Seventeen magazine and she's the before half of a Scarsdale Diet ad. HEATHER DUKE bashes her ball into VERONICA's and prepares to send it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people just don't matter. Why should those who do carry their weight? Am I right? As HEATHER DUKE swings down her mallet, VERONICA steps on her own ball. When HEATHER DUKE's mallet makes contact, the two balls slam against each other, unmoving, with a loud smack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you're wrong. It's not even your turn. The depressed and disoriented HEATHER MCNAMARA, laying against a tree, pipes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's right.....Boy, croquet's not the same without Heather. INT.  WETC T.V. STATION--DUSK In a sleek WETC station hallway, VERONICA SAWYER, a Guest Pass affixed to her heart, holds her hand in a spurting drinking fountain. She watches the water splash her car lighter burn-mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ich Luge bullets. I'm such a jerk. PETER DAWSON beams toward her, wearing a Guest Pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Veronica, I thought we lost you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was waiting for my friend Betty. VERONICA looks at her watch then joins PETER's march down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Teens talking it out on T.V.! Would it be pretentious of me to attach a videocassette of the show on my Princeton application?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shucks, that's a great idea, Pete. They burst through the studio double doors. STUDIO VERONICA and PETER take in a panorama of attractive, clean-cut STUDENTS from various schools chatting near Wine and Cheese tables set up to the side of an impressive, elevated, circular stage. All STUDENTS are wearing pink armbands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is excellent, but I thought we were going to get equal representation on this thind: Geeks, Gearheads... Out of nowhere, a bubbling HEATHER DUKE knots a pink armband around PETER's arm with a giggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're probably just being fashionably late. PETER DAWSON prances off with a raucous laugh. VERONICA stares dumbfounded at the wicked homogeneity of the STUDENTS as HEATHER DUKE ties a pink armband on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this very or what? Oh, you've gotta meet Whitney James! Come on! HEATHER DUKE tugs VERONICA across the crowded studio floor to where the WETC news set is situated. Smoking casually in her anchor's chair is the beautiful WHITNEY JAMES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whitney, here's my friend.....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah please sit down. HEATHER DUKE glides away. VERONICA uncomfortably steps onto the news set and moves down next to WHITNEY JAMES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a confession to make. My name used to be Heather, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But my name's not...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People just don't take the name Heather seriously. They should, shouldn't they? WINE AND CHEESE TABLE HEATHER MCNAMARA surreptitiously picks up a bottle of wine and with a sad expression, proceeds to down it. THE NEWS SET VERONICA apologizes to a blissfully oblivious WHITNEY JAMES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry. I was led to believe there were going to be different kinds of social and psychological types at this gathering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I was scared of the same thing, Heather. The minute you try to deal with the actual teenagers who have contemplated suicide you're stepping into quicksand. Quicksand filled with bad complexions, bad grades, bad parents, bad drugs, and all sorts of doody nobody wants to hear let alone bend down to clean up. WHITNEY JAMES tears open a bag of Corn Nuts and showers some into her mouth. She speaks as she sucks and chews.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not knocking teen suicide. It's exciting stuff. My personal faves are those kids from loaded families grabbing the mike to whine how even though they bagged a B.M.W. on their birthday, they're still quote-unquote depressed. It's ridiculous. People who say money can't buy happiness don't know where to shop. WHITNEY JAMES titters. VERONICA is a statue of mortification. EXT.   THE NEIGHBORHOOD PARK--TWILIGHT In the neighborhood park, gloomy members of various cliques sit in silence at picnic tables. All are ludicrously wearing Guest Passes. BETTY FINN mumbles down to her potato salad. EARL FRAZIER stoically stares off into space. Heavy Metaler CLYDE holds an absurdly large picnic basket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck? NEWS SET Completely flabbergasted, VERONICA manages a light tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The world wants winners, I guess. Not people stained with loserness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stained with loserness. Oh, I like it. Can I use that. It'd be dynamite on interoffice memoranda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all yours, Heather. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm going to go throw up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Ciao. STUDIO FLOOR Sickened, VERONICA stumbles onto the studio floor. Studio lights suddenly pop on, momentarily blinding her. PAULINE grabs VERONICA by the arm and shouts into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone take their places on the stage! (to Veronica) Isn't this thrilling?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Ms. Fleming, it's just not right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, the wine? I realize you're all under 21, but it seemed like such a perfect touch. (shouting upward) Could we get some more light up here? THE STAGE The pink armbanded Aryan youths form a circle on the circular stage. Pauline moves to a microphone at the center stage beside a seated WHITNEY JAMES who's tuning her electric guitar. VERONICA helplessly stands between the circle of STUDENTS and the two female hosts as the cameras go on. PAULINE sings/speaks into the microphone while WHITNEY JAMES strums her guitar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our schools have been torn apart by tragedy. Let's fuse them back together through love . Let's clasp hands and connect ourselves in one mighty circuit like a dove . The students sthereally reach out to each other and clasp hands. VERONICA quivers for a moment then bursts through a handholding HEATHER DUKE and HEATHER MCNAMARA and off the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's begin a new happiness... VERONICA swaggers past a seated TECHNICIAN. He pushes up a console lever causing the outer edge of the stage, where the circle of hand-holding students is, to slowly spin around the singing PAULINE and the strumming WHITNEY JAMES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...with no more suicide...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah... Ripping off her pink armband, VERONICA freezes. Standing at the wine and cheese table, gunslinger coat and all, is J.D. He turns around and raises his wine glass for a gleeful toast. J.D. Holy traumatic experiences, Batman. I'm sorry you felt you had to put yourself through all that shit. I told you it wouldn't...Hey, it's in the past already, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more problems.... Devastated,  VERONICA sways back toward the TECHNICIAN's console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah. VERONICA slams the lever back down forcing the spinning circle of handholding, pink-armbanded STUDENTS to crash to the ground around a taken-aback PAULINE and WHITNEY JAMES. J.D. Cute. WHITNEY JAMES playfully lets off a Hendrixian riff before coolly leaning over to her microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go for another take. OUTSIDE STUDIO DOORS VERONICA bursts through the studio doors, panting rapidly. She kicks off her shoes and begins to jog barefoot through the station hallway, weaving through various REPORTER-types. EXT.  OUTSIDE T.V. STATION--TWILIGHT VERONICA pops out the studio door, running faster. GRAVELLY ROAD She sprints down the side of a road. Her bare feet pound against sharp pebbles. THE NEIGHBORHOOD PARK VERONICA now barrels through the neighborhood park. She looks to her outcast classmates. In tableau, they stare back. BETTY FINN on a park carousel spins in and out of view. PROMENADE VERONICA speeds past the shops and the movie theatre. The viewer remains at the theatre ticket booth as MARTHA DUNNSTOCK/DUMPTRUCK wearing a BIGFUN T-shirt, pushes three dollars through the ticket window to a bored female cashier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bargain matinees are for the first show only.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I forgot. MARTHA puts two crumpled bucks through the window. The CASHIER shines a cruelly patronizing smile. INT. SAWYER FAMILY/T.V. ROOM--NIGHT VERONICA huffs and puffs into her family room where her MOM and DAD are watching T.V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Veronica, how'd that Teenage Prevention T.V. Suicide thing go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Color me educated. I learned high school happiness is for members only, Pauline Fleming wouldn't know reality if it lived in her uterus, and reality's name's Heather James. Also, J.D.'s a major creep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about, honey, but can it wait a bit. We're watching this special program on Teen Problems. VERONICA half-bitterly laughs at the irony. INT.  MOVIE THEATRE The light of the screen flickers on an overwhelmingly sullen MARTHA. She moves her leg and knocks a large Coke across the floor. She tragically stares at the Cola pool. SAWYER FAMILY/T.V. ROOM A DAN RATHER VOICE booms from the T.V. The SAWYERS stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh sure, I'll bet even back when I went to school there were drugs, even sex, but they were simpler times. The Sherwood suicides tell the bitter truth of today's young. What a waste...Oh VERONICA snaps off the T.V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn that back on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This condescending junk makes suicide seem like a cool thing to do. Hey kids, make your parents and teachers feel like shit! Get the respect in death you'll never get in life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we're not going to watch that program, can I put on the game?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you trying to tell me it is not a troubled time for the nation's youth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody cares for youth but nobody cares about Joey Blow. When that news reporter gets home he'll scream at his son for not mowing the lawn in the right pattern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm lost. You don't get enough attention, you get too much attention. Which is it? Where are your shoes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All we want is to be treated like human beings, not like guinea pigs to be experimented on and not like bunny rabbits to be patronized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't patronize bunny rabbits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Treated like human beings? Is that what you said little Miss Voice of a Generation? Just how do you think adults act with other adults? You think it's all just Doubles Tennis. Adults can be horrible to other adults. When teenagers complain that they want to be treated like human beings, it's usually because they are being treated like human beings. VERONICA leans against the wall with a melancholy smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I picked the wrong time to be a human being. MOM is embarassed for getting so involved. She meekly gestures to a tray of pate with a compassionate smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll live. Want some pate? HEATHER DUKE suddenly breezes in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi everyone, door was open. Veronica, you missed it! Pauline and Whitney James were up there doing there suicide rap when the cops come in and announce that Martha Dumptruck tried to buy the farm. She gave the ticket girl at the Colfax theatre a suicide note then bellyflopped in front of a car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the punchline. She's still alive, in stable condition. Another case of a geek trying to imitate the popular people of the school and failing miserably. Is that pate? VERONICA slaps HEATHER DUKE in the face. INT.   VERONICA'S BEDROOM--NIGHT HEATHER DUKE paces the room holding an icepack to her jaw. VERONICA is on the ground wiping off her bloodied feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said I was sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are out of control. Heather and Kurt were a shock, but Martha Dumptruck, get crucial! She dialed suicide hotlines in her diapers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not funny. Ouch! VERONICA rubs her feet. HEATHER DUKS shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What. A. Martyr. Understand; Martha couldn't take the heat so she got out of the kitchen. Just think what a better place the world would be if every nimrod followed her cue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just shut up and turn on the radio. Hot Probs is on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit, yeah. HEATHER DUKE hastens to the radio and flicks it on. Ripping open a bag of corn nuts, she sets herself down next to VERONICA as a TROUBLED MALE VOICE cuts the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it's supposed to be funny that they never get off the island, but still, sometimes I feel like I'm on that island and Gilligan can be just so stupid sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This sounds like a good one. INT.   RADIO STATION BOOTH A slob D.J. cackles into a W.E.T.C. conference call-type box. D.J. Dude, you've got to remember if it wasn't for the courage of the fearless crew, the Minnow would be lost. The Minnow would be lost! Next call!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Skipper hates me.... The D.J. rudely clicks off the TROUBLED MALE VOICE. D.J. Whoa, they're coming out early tonight. What ever happened to teen pregnancy and acne? You've got the Dogcatcher on W etcetera and you're listening to Hot Probs. Who am I talking to? INT.    HEATHER MCNAMARA'S BEDROOM--NIGHT HEATHER MCNAMARA is sitting clandestinely on her bedroom floor talking on the phone and through her radio. A dim Minnie Mouse lamp provides the room's only light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Heather, I mean, not Heather. HEATHER MCNAMARA looks up at a Madonna poster on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Madonna. Geez, no, not that. HEATHER MCNAMARA looks up to her Minnie Mouse lamp. VERONICA'S BEDROOM VERONICA and HEATHER DUKE simultaneously move into stunned kneeling positions, half-realizing who the caller is... D.J. (radio) Hey babe, I need a name? RADIO STATION BOOTH The D.J. looks to the conference call box with exasperation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Minnie. D.J. Ah, Minnie. Don't tell me, Mickey just confessed he got A.I.D.S. from Goofy at a New Year's Eve Party. HEATHER MCNAMARA'S BEDROOM A broken-down HEATHER MCNAMARA sobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God has cursed me, I think. The last time I had sex, the guy killed himself the next day. I'm failing Math. VERONICA'S BEDROOM HEATHER DUKE excitedlly jumps up as HEATHER MCNAMARA drones on.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WINE AND CHEESE TABLE HEATHER MCNAMARA
